channel.title: Question about basic access authentication
channel.description:
i'm trying to authenticate myself to a website which uses basic access authentication (from a java program)
i can log in to view the splash screen fine, but when i try to open any other protected page it says i am not authorised. i am sending the Authorization header each time i make a request. is this how a normal browser handles basic authentication?
i'm using tamper data on firefox to see what headers are sent, but it shows that the Authorization header is only sent when i login for the first time. all other requests seem to magically authorize myself, because there are no new headers and the cookie header only has analytics tracking code. maybe tamper data has just been bypassed or something?

item.title: Question about basic access authentication
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:336932”]so i’m doing it right then?

does a normal browser send any extra info associated with authentication, apart from the ‘Authorization’ header?

i don’t understand why i can’t view any other secure pages…

oh the site also uses https. does this make any difference?[/quote]
as long as you use a URL i dont see why it would

Read full topic
